item.title: Full Throttle Remastered arrives on iOS
item.description:
Finally! I’ve been waiting for this one for a while: “Full Throttle Remastered” has been released for iOS. The iPad has become my adventure gaming device of choice (aside from 8bit text adventures, and I’m trying to figure out a solution for that), so it’s great to see another LucasArts classic on the platform.

Not only that, but to coincide with the release Double Fine have slashed the prices of “Grim Fandango Remastered” and “The Day of the Tentacle Remastered” - both highly recommended and absolute bargains at this price.

item.title: Broken Age Part 1
item.description: The Double Fine Adventure Kickstarter was one of those few moments where you feel like you’re actually seeing a seismic shift in the industry. I jumped in within hours of the campaign going live - as a huge fan of adventure games, particularly those from Lucasfilm/Lucas Arts, I didn’t need to think twice. It’s been a really fascinating ride since then - the behind the scenes videos are the best accounts of game development ever committed to film, and I almost don’t want them to finish the game as that will mean the end of them. Earlier this week Double Fine released part 1 to the backers, while opening up pre- orders for everyone else. I started and finished the game over a period of a few hours yesterday. It’s certainly quite short, which should come as no surprise, but it really is a beautiful, charming game. At no point did it make me feel stupid, and there were a number of genuinely funny bits. I hope it sells absolute bucketloads so we can be treated to more games like this from the talented folk at Double Fine.
